content: Hi! I got four advisories merged three days ago. But I still don't see them on rustsec.org. When/how often is the website synchronized with the advisories in git?

My advisories are not critical or time sensitive. I'm just curious. Seems strange if there is a delay given the nature of the site, since there can be critical flaws announced that it would be good if people reacted to very fast.
It's a manual process right now. I can update it
It'd be great if someone figured out how to automate it :wink:

Tony Arcieri said:

It'd be great if someone figured out how to automate it :wink:

how is the site hosted?
it should be possible to do some sort of GitHub Actions automations, like the create-pull-request one we use to assign advisories

@Tony Arcieri could you trigger that once again? I've just merged a high-profile-ish advisory.
Also, what's up with pull request notifications? I see we have two PRs open but I didn't get any emails about them: https://github.com/RustSec/advisory-db/pulls
Do the times they come in overlap with when gmail was having trouble earlier this week?
wonder how hard it would be to move the web site over to a gh-pages branch of RustSec/advisory-db and use the create-pull-request action to update it
Did you get the notifications about the new pull requests? Have recently reorganized my email filters so I may have messed something up
Oh yeah, that looks like it was a problem on my end
